125.author: Mark Twain ; adapted by Naunerle Farr ; illustrated by Francisco Redondo.
notes: (Picture Classics)
Comics version.

Summary (from OCLC): A 19th-century boy, floating down the Mississippi River on a raft with a runaway slave, becomes involved with feuding family, two scoundrels pretending to be royalty, and Tom Sawyer's aunt, who mistakes him for Tom.

126.heading: Aunts.
126.title: "I Helped Jesse's Auntie Pull Quills from a Porcupine Skin"
126.author: Lynn Johnston.
126.series: For Better or For Worse, May 6, 2006
notes: Summary: Elizabeth writes a homesick e-mail to April.

127.heading: Aunts.
127.title: "Lapsus" p. 8 in Agrippina
127.author: Claire Bretécher (London : Methuen, 1991).
notes: Summary: Agrippina pities her mother and aunt, and they interpret her sadness as self-pity.

128.heading: Aunts.
128.title: Little Dot's Uncles & Aunts.
128.author: [No author]
notes: Published no. 1 (Oct. 1961) - no. 52 (Apr. 1974), cf. Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide.

129.heading: Aunts.
129.title: "Tip" p. 14 in Agrippina
129.author: Claire Bretécher (London : Methuen, 1991).
notes: Summary: Aunt Bibi brings a toy for Byron and money for Agrippina.

130.title: Aunt's in your Pants : memoirs of a dirty old woman
130.author: by Sergio Aragones.
notes: Caricatures and cartoons. I. Aragones, Sergio. Call no.: PN6727.A722A8 1967

131.heading: Auquier, Jean.
131.title: Guide for Belgium, Comic Strip Country
131.author: based upon an idea by Charles Dierick ; photography: Daniel Fouss ; texts: Christophe Canon, Jean Auquier, Rudi Miel.

publication info.publisher: Belgian Centre for Comic Strip Art

notes: Includes index.
Guidebook to public art based on comics.

132.heading: Auquier, Jean.
132.title: 9 Timbres pour le 9e Art : Hommage : 10e Anniversaire du Centre Belge de la Bande Dessinée
132.author: textes, Jean Auquier.

publication info.publisher: Centre Belge de la Bande Dessinée

notes: Cancelled sheet of 9 comics-related postage stamps mounted on p. 5. Text includes illustrated articles on each of 8 strips and authors so honored: Corentin by Paul Cuvelier, Jerry Spring by Jijé, Gil Jourdan by Maurice Tillieux, La Patrouille des Castors by MiTacq, Hassan et Kaddour by Jacques Laudy, Buck Danny by Vic Hubinon, Tif et Tondu by Fernand Dineur, Timour by Sirius, and one stamp honoring the 10th anniversary of the Centre.
